regular_tests.name: codeblock_hilite
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

def speak(self):
    x = 1

regular_tests.name: codeblock_multiline
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet once said
~~~~
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3
~~~~
And all was good.
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet once said

def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3

And all was good.
regular_tests.text_content:
Hamlet once said
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3



And all was good.

regular_tests.name: codeblock_trailing_whitespace
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet once said
~~~~
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2		

    z = 3       
~~~~
And all was good.
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet once said

def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3

And all was good.
regular_tests.text_content:
Hamlet once said
def func():
    x = 1

    y = 2

    z = 3



And all was good.

regular_tests.name: hanging_multi_codeblock

Hamlet said:

def speak(self):
    x = 1
# Comment to make this code block longer to test Trac #1162

Then he mentioned y = 4 + x**2 and

def foobar(self):
    return self.baz()

regular_tests.name: fenced_quote
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet said:
~~~ quote
To be or **not** to be.

That is the question
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

To be or not to be.

That is the question
regular_tests.text_content:
Hamlet said:
> To be or not to be.
> That is the question

regular_tests.name: fenced_nested_quote
regular_tests.input:
Hamlet said:
~~~ quote
Polonius said:
> This above all: to thine ownself be true,
And it must follow, as the night the day,
Thou canst not then be false to any man.

What good advice!
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
Hamlet said:

Polonius said:

This above all: to thine ownself be true,
And it must follow, as the night the day,
Thou canst not then be false to any man.

What good advice!
regular_tests.text_content:
Hamlet said:
> Polonius said:
> > This above all: to thine ownself be true,
> > And it must follow, as the night the day,
> > Thou canst not then be false to any man.
> What good advice!

regular_tests.name: complexly_nested_quote
regular_tests.input:
I heard about this second hand...
~~~ quote

He said:
~~~ quote
The customer is complaining.

They looked at this code:
``` 
def hello(): print 'hello
```
They would prefer:
~~~
def hello()
  puts 'hello'
end
~~~

Please advise.
~~~

She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```
~~~
regular_tests.expected_output:
I heard about this second hand...

He said:

The customer is complaining.

They looked at this code:

def hello(): print 'hello

They would prefer:

def hello()
puts 'hello'
end

Please advise.

She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```
regular_tests.marked_expected_output:
I heard about this second hand...

He said:

The customer is complaining.

They looked at this code:

def hello(): print 'hello

They would prefer:

def hello()
puts 'hello'
end

Please advise.


She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```
regular_tests.text_content:
I heard about this second hand...
> He said:
> > The customer is complaining.
> > They looked at this code:
> > def hello(): print 'hello
> > They would prefer:
> def hello()
>   puts 'hello'
> end

Please advise.
She said:
~~~ quote
Just send them this:
```
echo "hello
"
```

Two items
Three items

  • Three items

Two items

regular_tests.name: ulist_with_inline_code
regular_tests.input:
gonna take a break for a bit--all yours if you want to play around too. what I did:

* install cmake
* git clone zulip desktop
* run `cmake-gui ..` in `c:\zulip\zulip-desktop\msvcbuild`
* hit configure/generate until it generated the msvc project (had to make a fix to some cmake files)
* opened vs2013 
* tried to build
regular_tests.expected_output:
gonna take a break for a bit--all yours if you want to play around too. what I did:

  • install cmake
  • git clone zulip desktop
  • run cmake-gui .. in c:\zulip\zulip-desktop\msvcbuild
  • hit configure/generate until it generated the msvc project (had to make a fix to some cmake files)
  • opened vs2013
  • tried to build
regular_tests.text_content:
gonna take a break for a bit--all yours if you want to play around too. what I did:

install cmake
git clone zulip desktop
run cmake-gui .. in c:\zulip\zulip-desktop\msvcbuild
hit configure/generate until it generated the msvc project (had to make a fix to some cmake files)
opened vs2013 
tried to build
